profile.name: Khush Jain
profile.title: Assistant Manager – Cloud Engineering (AWS)
profile.summary: Cloud Engineering professional with 3+ years of experience delivering scalable, secure, and compliant AWS solutions for fintech and enterprise environments. Strong expertise in Disaster Recovery, air-gapped architectures, cloud automation, cost optimization, and security hardening. Proven track record in client/stakeholder management, cross-team delivery, and leading cloud engineering teams.

timeline.summary: Lead cloud delivery for a fintech finance application. Manage a team of 4 cloud engineers across build, release, and production support. Driving DR architecture, WAF hardening, S3 cost governance, and automation initiatives.

Led AWS cloud administration and infrastructure delivery for enterprise applications. Implemented DR and backup strategies including air-gapped environments. Re-architected flagship app improving RTO from 18h to 6h. Built Blue-Green pipelines and Python automation scripts.

missions.title: Operation Iron Continuity
missions.tagline: Multi-region DR with air-gapped recovery at Fibe
missions.challenge: Fibe's fintech finance application had no tested disaster recovery plan. A real outage risked regulatory penalties and complete service disruption for customers. Compliance requirements demanded air-gapped recovery capabilities.
missions.solution: Designed and implemented a multi-region Disaster Recovery architecture with air-gapped recovery solutions. Conducted regular failover testing and restoration validation. Aligned DR runbooks with compliance requirements and coordinated stakeholder sign-offs. Ensured business continuity across all failure scenarios.

missions.title: Operation Team Command
missions.tagline: Leading 4 engineers across build, release & production
missions.challenge: Fibe's cloud engineering function needed structured leadership to manage build, release, and production support for a high-stakes fintech application. Delivery timelines and engineering quality needed oversight.
missions.solution: Stepped up as Assistant Manager leading 4 cloud engineers. Established structured processes for build, release, and production support. Introduced CI/CD-driven deployments, automation for secrets management and password rotation, and cleanup of unused cloud resources to improve security and operational efficiency.

missions.title: Operation Cost Siege
missions.challenge: Uncontrolled S3 storage costs were spiraling at Fibe due to lack of lifecycle governance. Large volumes of stale objects accumulated with no automated retention or cleanup policies.
missions.solution: Implemented S3 lifecycle policies and usage analysis to automatically tier and expire unused data. Built cleanup automation and standardized governance policies across all buckets. Delivered ongoing $4,000/month in S3 cost savings while improving compliance posture.

missions.title: Operation Iron Uptime
missions.challenge: ZS Associates' flagship enterprise application had an 18-hour RTO with untested recovery runbooks. A real disaster would have cost hundreds of thousands of dollars in downtime penalties and business disruption.
missions.solution: Re-architected the application's resilience posture from the ground up. Introduced multi-region failover, validated backup/restore procedures, and rebuilt deployment pipelines with Blue-Green strategy (CodePipeline + CodeDeploy + EC2) for zero-downtime releases. Reduced RTO from 18 hours to 6 hours.

missions.title: Operation Cyber Shield
missions.tagline: WAF hardening, ISO 27001 alignment, 2PB data cleanup
missions.challenge: ZS Associates faced DDoS and bot traffic with no WAF controls. An ISO/IEC 27001:2022 audit also exposed ~2 PB of non-compliant, unmanaged S3 data without proper retention or access governance.
missions.solution: Deployed AWS WAF on CloudFront with custom rules for bot and DDoS mitigation, improving traffic visibility and security posture. Led the ISO 27001:2022 ISMS remediation — removed ~2 PB of unused S3 data, standardized lifecycle and backup policies, and hardened access controls. Achieved full audit alignment.
